intro: Amoora nitidula, commonly known as the white-flowered hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, making it an important plant in local ecosystems.
